content.question: A scientist is attempting to provide support for the hypothesis that <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> was the first genetic material. Which of the following would be a workable alternate hypothesis?

choices.label: <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math>, like <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math>, is a carrier of genetic information and contains the nitrogen bases adenine, guanine, and cytosine.

<math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> can be observed to self-replicate without the assistance of proteins, while <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> always requires protein-based enzymes to replicate.

<math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> exists in both single-stranded and double-stranded configurations; however, it is less stable compared with <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math>.

Transfer <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> and ribosomal <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> are products of transcription, but they are not translated as is <math alttext="m R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></math> can be observed to self-replicate without the assistance of proteins, while <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> always requires protein-based enzymes to replicate.

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
